If the target is a Large or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by the deep dweller, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the deep dweller, and it takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the deep dweller's turns. If the deep dweller takes 15 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the deep dweller must succeed on a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the deep dweller. If the deep dweller is reduced to 0 hit points or otherwise defeated, it vomits out all swallowed creatures and a burst of black, bloody ichor before fleeing.

Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and if the deep dweller attacks and hits another target with the same tentacle, instead of grappling the new target, the currently {@condition grappled} creature takes 3 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage. If the deep dweller hits a Huge or larger target with three tentacle attacks in the same round, it can use all three tentacles to grapple the target, and the deep dweller can't use those tentacles on another target until this grapple ends.

entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 10} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target {@condition grappled} by the deep dweller. {@h}23 ({@damage 5d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Psychic Drain
entries: One creature {@condition grappled} by the deep dweller must make on a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw. A creature takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one, and the deep dweller regains a number of hit points equal to half the damage dealt. If the creature fails this saving throw by 10 or more, it also suffers a level of long-term madness.

action.name: Blinding Scream {@recharge 5}
entries: The deep dweller unleashes a pulse of psychic energy, which radiates out from it in a 120-foot radius sphere. Creatures in the area must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw. A creature takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) psychic damage and is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute on a failed save, or takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition blinded} on a successful one. A {@condition blinded} creature can attempt this saving throw again at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature can't be {@condition blinded} by this feature for the next 24 hours.

The deep dweller can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The deep dweller regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Tentacle Attack
entries: The deep dweller makes a tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Constrict
entries: The deep dweller uses its Constrict.

legendary.name: Hide
entries: The deep dweller takes the Hide action.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Umbrafang can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Creature of Legend
entries: Umbrafang is a unique creature of legend. Its weapon attacks are magical, and it has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: When in water, Umbrafang ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If Umbrafang fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Toxic Aura
entries: At the start of Umbrafang's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. A creature that touches Umbrafang or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Stagnant Protection
entries: Umbrafang has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks when in stagnant or still water. In addition, when underwater, it has a +2 bonus to its AC against attacks originating from out of or above water.

trait.name: Powerful Swimmer
entries: Umbrafang can move at full speed when grappling a single target, and half speed when grappling up to three separate targets. Targets are pulled along by Umbrafang as it moves, and remain within 15 feet of it at all times.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Umbrafang makes three tentacle attacks. It can replace one tentacle attack with a single use of Bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by Umbrafang, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside Umbrafang and it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage at the start of each of Umbrafang's turns. Umbrafang can only have one target swallowed at a time. If Umbrafang dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.
If the target is Large or smaller it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}).
Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and Umbrafang can't use that tentacle on another target.
Umbrafang has 6 tentacles. Each can be used to grapple a different target.

action.name: Toxic Mucus (Out of Water Only, Recharge 5 - 6)
entries: Umbrafang releases globules of sticky mucus from bulbous glands across its body, which scatter out from it in a 10-foot radius sphere. The mucus remains on the ground for 1 minute, or until washed away by 5 or more gallons of fresh water. A creature that starts its turn in the area or moves within the area for the first time on its turn must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the mucus for 1 minute. A {@condition restrained} creature can attempt this saving throw again at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Acidic Spittle {@recharge 5}
entries: Umbrafang vomits up a corrosive spittle in a 5-foot-wide, 30-foot-long line. Creatures caught in the line must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage.

If a creature who is wearing nonmagical armor fails this saving throw, the armor takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed.

If Umbrafang uses this ability while it has a creature swallowed, the creature is vomited up along with the spittle, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage and landing {@condition prone} at the end of the 30-foot line. If the creature is wearing nonmagical armor, the AC it offers is immediately and permanently reduced by 1. If this would place the vomited creature in a space already occupied by another creature, the occupying creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity throw or be pushed 5 feet and knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Tentacle Attack
entries: Umbrafang makes a tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Fish's Flurry
entries: Umbrafang moves up to half its movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Digestion Glands (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Umbrafang recharges either its Acidic Spittle or Toxic Mucus

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Umbrafang can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Creature of Legend
entries: Umbrafang is a unique creature of legend. Its weapon attacks are magical, and it has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: When in water, Umbrafang ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Toxic Aura
entries: At the start of Umbrafang's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

trait.name: Stagnant Protection
entries: Umbrafang has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks when in stagnant or still water. In addition, when underwater, it has a +2 bonus to its AC against attacks originating from out of or above water.

trait.name: Powerful Swimmer
entries: Umbrafang can move at full speed when grappling a single target. A target is pulled along by Umbrafang as it moves, and remain within 15 feet of it at all times.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Umbrafang makes two tentacle attacks, one of which it can replace with one use of Bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by Umbrafang, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside Umbrafang and it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage at the start of each of Umbrafang's turns. Umbrafang can only have one target swallowed at a time. If Umbrafang dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 5} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target.  {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Large or smaller it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and Umbrafang can't use that tentacle on another target.
Umbrafang has 6 tentacles. Each can be used to grapple a different target.

action.name: Toxic Mucus (Out of Water Only, Recharge 5 - 6)
entries: Umbrafang releases globules of sticky mucus from bulbous glands across its body, which scatter out from it in a 10-foot radius sphere. The mucus remains on the ground for 1 minute, or until washed away by 5 or more gallons of fresh water. A creature that starts its turn in the area or moves within the area for the first time on its turn must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the mucus for 1 minute. A {@condition restrained} creature can attempt this saving throw again at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Acidic Spittle {@recharge 5}
entries: Umbrafang vomits out a corrosive spittle in a 5-foot-wide, 30-foot-long line. Creatures caught in the line must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage.

If a creature who is wearing nonmagical armor fails this saving throw, the armor takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed.

If Umbrafang uses this ability while it has a creature swallowed, the creature is vomited up along with the spittle, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage and landing {@condition prone} at the end of the 30-foot line. If the creature is wearing nonmagical armor, the AC it offers is immediately and permanently reduced by 1. If this would place the vomited creature in a space already occupied by another creature, the occupying creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity throw or be pushed 5 feet and knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

Umbrafang can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Umbrafang regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Tentacle Attack
entries: Umbrafang makes a tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Fish's Flurry
entries: Umbrafang moves up to half its movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

item.name: Deep Blade
entries: rare

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: Save DC 17, +2 to attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Illusion

This rugged blade is crafted from the protruding spines of the deep dweller's grasping tendrils. While not overly sharp, the blade's serrated edge gives it a fearsome intimidating appearance. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Additionally, this sword has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d3} charges each night at the stroke of midnight.

When you hit a creature with this blade, you can expend 1 charge to force that creature to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target's eyes are covered in an inky, magical darkness, and the target becomes {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success

item.name: Deep Dweller Leather
entries: rare

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: Grants an additional +2 bonus to AC.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Illusion
This thick leather armor settles on your body like a rubbery mass, protecting you from harm while remaining as light as a feather.
While you are in {@quickref Vision and Light||2} or darkness, you are {@condition invisible} to creatures that are more than 30 feet away from you.

item.name: Deep Dweller Shield
entries: uncommon

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: While holding this shield, you have a +1 bonus to AC. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Illusion

Once per day, you can use your action to slam the shield into the ground and cast {@spell darkness} at 2nd level. The magical darkness remains for 1 minute or until dispelled. Quiet screams and distant cries of terror can be heard emanating from within the spell's radius.

This shield is made from wood covered in the thick leather hide of the deep dweller and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

item.name: Deep Fang Daggers
entries: rare (requires attunement)

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: Each dagger has a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Illusion
This pair of daggers are carved from the fangs of the legendary deep dweller. Each dagger is a single piece; beginning with a smooth, sinewy handle and ending in a razor-sharp point.

Each dagger deals an additional {@damage 1d4} psychic damage when you hit a creature with this magic weapon, or {@dice 1d6} additional psychic damage if you are wielding a deep fang dagger in each hand. Additionally, when you dual wield these daggers, they emit wistful echoes and shrieks when passing by each other. Any creature within 10 feet of you who can hear the shrieks has disadvantage on attack rolls against you unless they are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition.

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: Save DC 17

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Enchantment
This deadly vial contains a dark, thick poison that, when applied to an open wound or ingested, induces severe vomiting and hysteria.

As an action, you can throw the vial towards a point you can see within 20 feet of you. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Alternatively, you can rub the poison directly into a creature's open wound by using your action to make a melee weapon attack against the target. On a successful hit, the target becomes {@condition poisoned}. A creature {@condition poisoned} by Deepblood Poison can't take reactions and must roll a {@dice d10} at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn:

The {@condition poisoned} creature can make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw at the end of its subsequent turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A target automatically succeeds on this saving throw if it has all of its hit points, but automatically fails this saving throw if it instead ingests the poison, such as by consuming {@condition poisoned} food or drink. A creature so {@condition poisoned} (by ingestion) can only recover by way of lesser restoration or similar magic.

rows: The target uses all its movement to run, screaming, in a random direction. To determine the direction, roll a d8 and assign a direction to each die face. The target doesn't take an action this turn.
The target doesn't move or take an action this turn, instead spending its turn vomiting black blood profusely.

The target uses its action to make a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach, while rambling incoherently. If there is no creature within its reach, the creature instead targets its own features, such as nails, hands, hair or ears.
The target moves and acts normally.

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: Save DC 17, +2 bonus to attack rolls.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Illusion

This barbed arrow is carved from the remains of the deep dweller's tendril spines. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this piece of magic ammunition. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is no longer magical. Additionally, if you hit a creature with more than one of these arrows in the same turn, the target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition blinded} for 1 minute as their eyes become infected with a magical darkness.
A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: Save DC 17, {=bonusWeapon} to attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Illusion

This axe sports a fearsome and intimidating serrated head, forged from the spines of a deep dweller tentacle. You have a {=bonusWeapon} bonus to attack and damage rolls with this weapon, and it deals an additional {@damage 1d6} slashing damage on a successful hit. Additionally, the weapon has 3 charges. It regains {@dice 1d3} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature that doesn't have all its hit points with this weapon, you can expend 1 charge to force it to make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} target can attempt the saving throw again at the end of each of its following turns, ending the effect on a success.

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: Grants the interior crew immunity to psychic damage, instead of resistance.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Abjuration

This upgrade coats a ship's hull in a jet-black coat of powdered deep dweller flesh. The hull and other components of the ship are immune to lightning damage. Crew inside the ship have resistance to psychic damage, and advantage on saving throws made to resist mind-altering spells and other magical effects.
This feature doesn't extend to crew in the crow's nest, or on deck, only to those inside the ship itself.

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: Heals {@dice 4d4 + 4} and {@dice 4d8 + 8} respectively.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Evocation

This thick, clear gel can be applied to an open wound, forming a protective, binding seal over the wound that prevents blood loss and accelerates healing. A single vial contains three doses. As an action, one dose can be applied to the skin.

The creature that receives it regains {@dice 2d4 + 4} hit points. The gel is more effective at promoting recovery if a body is resting. If applied during a short rest, the creature instead regains {@dice 2d8 + 8} hit points.

If applied to a creature who is dying, the gel stabilizes the creature immediately, but they remain {@condition unconscious} until awoken by other stimuli. How many hit points the {@condition unconscious} creature regains depends on how long they are allowed to rest. If the creature awakens in less than an hour they get {@dice 2d4 + 4} hit points, whereas if it is an hour or more they awaken with {@dice 2d8 + 8} hit points instead.

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: Tape can be re-used once. Covers 10 x 10 ft.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Enchantment

A small roll of thin, porous material, crafted from the suckers of a deep dweller tentacle. You can spend ten minutes to unravel the tape and bandage a {@condition poisoned}, {@condition petrified}, or diseased creature. The target creature's condition is slowly absorbed into the material over the course of {@dice 1d4} hours. Once absorbed, the tape is destroyed and can no longer be used, and the condition ends on that creature.
There is enough tape on the roll to cover a 5 ft x 5 ft area.

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: You can also cast the {@spell sending} spell without requiring components, however the potion's effect ends after the spell is cast.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Enchantment

This potion glows with a dim, green hue when held towards the light. When poured, it has the consistency of water, but moves as a single, ooze-like entity. When you drink this potion, you gain advantage on Intelligence ability checks and Intelligence saving throws for 1 hour.
Additionally, for the duration you can cast the {@spell message} cantrip without requiring components.

item.name: Notched Dweller Whip
entries: (requires attunement)

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Illusion
A whip, made from hardened leather and layered with hooked spines crafted from a deep dweller fang. The whip is black and rubbery in texture, and appears to twitch slightly when unsheathed.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this weapon, and it deals an additional {@damage 1d4} psychic damage on a hit.

As an action you can begin spinning the whip around you, and if you concentrate on the whip as if concentrating on a spell, it will continue spinning around you for the next minute even after you let go of it. For this duration the whip emits a haunting shriek that can be heard out to 100 feet, and the first time a hostile creature comes within 10 feet of you or starts its turn there, it takes {@damage 4d4} psychic damage.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again in this way again until you finish a long rest.
